## Install `R` {.tabset}
<hr>

![](images/r_logo.png){width="170" style="float: left; margin-top: -6px; margin-right: 30px;"}

<br>
The R language is built and contributed to by people all around the world. It lets you perform data analysis just like you're following a recipe for cookies. Once you find your favorite recipe you can use it over and over again and easily share it with your collaborators.

<br><br><br>

### Instructions for MPCA 

1. Open the ` G:\Lapps\R ` folder.
1. Double click the ` R-3.4.2-win.exe ` file.
1. In the pop-up window, click the Ok and Next buttons until you reach the end.

<br>


### Instructions for everyone  

1. Open your web browser and navigate to R's download page -> [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org)
1. Choose your operating system from the top. Or use the shortcuts below.
    - __WINDOWS__ go here: [Windows](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/)
    - __MAC__ go here: [Mac](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/)
        - Scroll down and download the highest numbered file (ex. _R-3.5.1.pkg_)
    - __LINUX__ go here: [Linux](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/linux/)
1. Save the file and install with the default options.


  
## Install `RStudio` 
<hr>

![](images/rstudio-hex.png){style="float: right; margin-top: -12px;"}

__RStudio__ is the handy user interface we use to write R scripts and keep our projects organized. It isn't required to use R, but it makes things a whole lot easier.

<br>

__Install RStudio__  

1. Open your web browser and navigate to [www.rstudio.com](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download)
1. Choose your operating system and download the newest version
1. Open the file and install with the default options
1. You are officially ready to __R__

<br>
